chapter.title: DNSCrypt client proxy
chapter.para: The DNSCrypt client proxy relays DNS queries to a DNSCrypt enabled upstream resolver. The traffic between the client and the upstream resolver is encrypted and authenticated, mitigating the risk of MITM attacks, DNS poisoning attacks, and third-party snooping (assuming the upstream is trustworthy).

sect1.title: Basic configuration
sect1.para:
To enable the client proxy, set
services.dnscrypt-proxy.enable = true;

The default configuration assumes that the DNSCrypt client proxy is intended to act as a transparent proxy for the system stub resolver. The proxy is automatically configured to do its own caching in this configuration.
Enabling the client proxy does not alter the system nameserver; to actually relay local queries, prepend 127.0.0.1 to networking.nameservers.
